bug.author: flx42
bug.summary: Dataset information not shown when cloning a model
bug.description:
When creating a new model and selecting a dataset: <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3645581/14861912/13cdf5c6-0c64-11e6-8117-6d9bf9341c5a.png></denchmark-link>
When cloning a model: <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3645581/14861874/d8c55492-0c63-11e6-9c14-4b956db1c734.png></denchmark-link>
If you only have one dataset, I don't see a way of having the information displayed. If you have multiple datasets in the list, click on any other dataset, then back on the one you want.

comments.comment: While we're at this, maybe tackle some of the other minor cloning issues, of which a few have been fixed last week. Problem: different label upon cloning Steps: (1) Make a model job, name it "test" (2) Change the label name, name it "test renamed" (3) Click clone (4) The actual cloned name will be "test", not "test renamed".

Thanks for the bug report <denchmark-link:https://github.com/flx42>@flx42</denchmark-link>
This should be fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/pull/713>#713</denchmark-link>
